name: Museums for All
description: Museums for All is a national program connecting low-income families with cultural institutions, ensuring that financial barriers don't prevent anyone from experiencing the enrichment museums offer.
fullDescription: Museums for All is a national program connecting low-income families with cultural institutions, ensuring that financial barriers don't prevent anyone from experiencing the enrichment museums offer.
whatTheyOffer:
- Free or reduced admission ($3 or less per person)
- Admission for EBT cardholder plus up to 4 guests
- Access to 1,700+ participating museums nationwide
- Includes science centers, children's museums, art museums, and more
howToGetIt: Visit any participating museum and present your EBT (SNAP/CalFresh) card along with a photo ID at the admissions desk. No reservation needed at most locations, but some may require advance booking.
